Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics

Interface StateMachineContext

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
@Modifiable public interface StateMachineContext extends Serializable
Context tracking for state machine operations, providing state management and branching support.

This interface manages the context for state transitions in the agent-based modeling framework:

  • Tracks the baseline (default) state for the state machine
  • Maintains a stack of branch states for temporary state transitions
  • Captures reactive testing flags that influence state behavior
  • Provides operations for managing state branching and recovery

Branching Mechanism

The branching mechanism allows state machines to temporarily enter alternative states (e.g., testing states, non-compliance behaviors) and then return to the baseline. Branches are managed as a stack structure (LIFO) through pushState(State) and corresponding pull methods.

Integration with StateMachine

This context is primarily used by StateMachine to manage state transitions: StateMachine.forceTo(BehaviourState) and StateMachine.forceTo(PolicyState) push the current state to branches before switching, while StateMachine.returnFromBranch() retrieves states using the pull methods.

Reactive Testing

The #isReactivelyTestedToday() flag indicates whether a reactive testing event occurred today, which may influence state transitions (e.g., entering isolation after positive test results). The flag is reset daily through resetFlags().

  • Method Details

    • getBaselineState

      State<?,?,?,?> getBaselineState()
      Gets the baseline (default) state for the state machine. This is the state to which the machine returns after all branches are exhausted.
      Returns:
      the baseline state object

    • getBranchState

      List<State<?,?,?,?>> getBranchState()
      Gets the current stack of branch states. States are maintained in order from most recent to oldest.
      Returns:
      an ordered list of branch states (most recent first)

    • isReactivelyTestedToday

      boolean isReactivelyTestedToday()
      Checks if a reactive testing event occurred today. Reactive testing typically refers to testing triggered by symptoms or contact tracing.
      Returns:
      true if reactive testing occurred today, false otherwise

    • pullBehaviour

      default State.BehaviourState pullBehaviour()
      Pulls and removes the most recent behavior state from the branch stack. If no branches exist, returns to the baseline state.
      Returns:
      the next behavior state to transition to
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the retrieved state is not a behavior state

    • pullPolicy

      default State.PolicyState pullPolicy()
      Pulls and removes the most recent policy state from the branch stack. If no branches exist, returns to the baseline state.
      Returns:
      the next policy state to transition to
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the retrieved state is not a policy state

    • pushState

      default void pushState(State<?,?,?,?> state)
      Pushes the current state to the branch stack. This operation is typically called before forcing a state transition to preserve the current state for later recovery.
      Parameters:
      state - the state to push onto the branch stack

    • resetFlags

      default void resetFlags()
      Resets daily flags including the reactive testing flag. Called at the beginning of each simulation day to clear transient state.

    • setReactivelyTestedToday

      StateMachineContext setReactivelyTestedToday(boolean flag)
      Sets the reactive testing flag to indicate testing occurred today.
      Parameters:
      flag - true if reactive testing occurred, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the updated context with the new flag value
